Package edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm

Reimplementation of the syntactic MT models described in (Galley et al., 2004; Galley et al., 2006), plus some features not available in the original implementation: Markovization (in progress) and filtering against a given dev/test set.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
FeatureExtractor Collect statistics (e.g., relative frequency estimation, Markovization) on GHKM rules.
 

Class Summary
AbstractFeatureExtractor  
AlignmentGraph A graph containing two types of edges: (1) edges of an English parse tree and (2) word alignments between a French sentence and leaf nodes of the English tree.
AlignmentTreeNode An English tree (class AlignmentTreeNode) that contains annotation of the "crossings" (Fox, 2002), i.e., cases where RHS consituents of a given CFG production have English yields that align to overlapping Chinese phrases (i.e., there is no sensible way of reordering these consituents).
RelativeFrequencyFeatureExtractor Relative frequencies of GHKM rules, and their LHS and RHS.
Rule  
RuleExtractor Main class for performing GHKM rule extraction.
RuleIndex Index and counts for GHKM rules and their LHS (target language) and RHS (source language).
RuleInstance  
StringNumberer  
UnalignedWordSet Class representing a set of unaligned foreign words that may appear in RHS constituents of a rule.
UnigramRuleFilter Filter rules against words of a given corpus.
 

Package edu.stanford.nlp.mt.syntax.ghkm Description

Reimplementation of the syntactic MT models described in (Galley et al., 2004; Galley et al., 2006), plus some features not available in the original implementation: Markovization (in progress) and filtering against a given dev/test set. Please do not redistribute, since it would lead to serious patent issues with Language Weaver.

Author:
Michel Galley
